channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Pompeo says Hong Kong is no longer autonomous from China, jeopardizing billions in trade
CNN reporter gets caught in scuffle during Hong Kong protests
item.description: Protests have erupted in the heart of Hong Kong's financial center. Police have fired pepper spray to disperse crowds as the city's legislative council debates the controversial national anthem bill. CNN's Anna Coren reports.

item.title: 100,000 deaths: America's Covid-19 toll brings its own awful judgments on Trump's response
SpaceX and NASA's historic launch will have to wait a few more days
item.description: â€¢ Opinion: Why we're rocketing people into space during a pandemic

item.title: Christian Cooper is asking people to stop making death threats against the woman who called the cops on him
She called police on him in Central Park. Hear what he has to say
item.description: Christian Cooper speaks with CNN's Don Lemon about the encounter he had with a white woman who called the police on him during an encounter involving her unleashed dog in Central Park.

item.title: Anchors brawl in explosive exchange: '100,000 people died ... And all you did was try to help your friend the President!'
item.description: CNBC "Squawk Box" anchors Andrew Ross Sorkin and Joe Kernen clashed on Wednesday, trading a series of ugly jabs in a fiery on-air exchange over each of their responses to the seriousness of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Australia angered China by calling for a coronavirus investigation. Now Beijing is targeting it
item.description: It didn't take long after Australia's first calls for an international investigation into the origins of the coronavirus pandemic before rumblings of retaliation came from Beijing.

item.title: Trump is threatening to 'regulate' or 'close' social media platforms. His options are limited
Trump mocks journalist for wearing mask
item.description: CNN's Jim Acosta reports that President Trump is stoking a "culture war" over not wearing masks, mocking Reuters White House correspondent Jeff Mason for wearing one at a press briefing.

item.title: Inside one of the world's largest brothels a desperate situation is unfolding
Boeing is building the 737 Max again even though it's not yet approved to fly
item.description: Boeing restarted production of the troubled 737 Max Wednesday, even though the Federal Aviation Administration has yet to give its approval for the jet to fly again, and as demand for new jets has ground to a near halt along with demand for air travel.

item.title: Plan to resume flights between Australia and New Zealand expected soon
A terrifying, 13-foot laughing kookaburra is being driven around an Australian town
item.description: Many of us have been flexing our creative muscles in recent months, making the most of the coronavirus lockdown to get stuck into those DIY projects we've been been putting off.

item.title: Salvadoran leader says he takes hydroxychloroquine
item.description: Salvadoran President Nayib Bukele said Tuesday he uses hydroxychloroquine, the anti-malarial drug touted by US President Donald Trump as a potential coronavirus cure, even though international health experts have questioned its efficacy and have warned of harmful side-effects.

item.title: Boeing lays off nearly 7,000 workers
item.description: Boeing let go 6,770 workers Wednesday, part of a reduction of 16,000 total jobs it plans to implement in response to reduced demand for air travel during the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Imagine giving up your child. This mother is considering it
item.description: Thousands of migrant domestic workers are stranded in Lebanon now jobless, penniless and some homeless with no way out as coronavirus exacerbates the country's economic crisis. CNN's Jomana Karadsheh reports.

item.title: Trump administration considering new weapons sale to Saudi Arabia, top Democrat says
item.description: The Trump administration is considering yet another weapons sale to Saudi Arabia despite the fact that it is facing scrutiny from congressional Democrats who believe Secretary of State Mike Pompeo may have recommended the firing of an independent watchdog because he was investigating the top US diplomat's controversial decision to fast-track a previous arms deal to the Kingdom.

item.title: Three killed at business meeting in France
item.description: Three people were killed and one injured in western France on Wednesday after a man open fired during a business meeting, national police told CNN.

item.title: Professional soccer player dies aged 23
item.description: Professional footballer Christian Mbulu has died at the age of 23, according to a statement from his team, Morecambe FC.

item.title: Video shows a woman pushing her 9-year-old son into a canal, police say
item.description: Newly released video obtained by CNN network partner Univision shows the moment a Florida woman who's been arrested in the death of her 9-year-old son pushes him into a canal.

item.title: Choir practice turned into a Covid-19 'super spreader' event
item.description: CNN's Randi Kaye reports on rising concerns over potential coronavirus 'super spreader' events and the implications these have on infection transmission.

item.title: Scenes from inside Brazil's worst-hit city
item.description: The Amazon city of Manaus has been grappling for weeks with a horror that the rest of Brazil has partially ignored at the advice of their President, Jair Bolsonaro.

item.title: With tourists gone, Amsterdam locals reclaim their city
item.description: A couple of weeks after the first coronavirus case arrived in the Netherlands, we were told to stay inside. Bars and schools closed down and my hometown of Amsterdam came to a halt.

item.title: Disney World sets reopening date
item.description: Disney World will reopen its gates, ending a multi-month closure of the park that left the Walt Disney Company reeling.

item.title: This is what touring Spain this summer could look like
item.description: CNN's Atika Shubert reports on plans underway in Spain to ease foreign travel restrictions in an effort to welcome back tourists, despite concerns over Covid-19.

item.title: Jimmy Fallon apologizes for Chris Rock impersonation in blackface on 'SNL'
item.description: Jimmy Fallon is addressing his impersonation of Chris Rock in a "Saturday Night Live" sketch from 20 years ago in which he appeared in blackface.

item.title: Scientists didn't detect a parallel universe in Antarctica. But they are learning more about mysterious, ghostly neutrinos
item.description: Even though we can't see them, we live our lives surrounded by neutrinos.

item.title: Perfectly preserved ancient Roman mosaic floor discovered
item.description: A beautiful and remarkably well preserved mosaic floor from ancient Rome has been discovered by archaeologists in northern Italy.

item.title: Christian singer reveals he no longer believes in God
item.description: Jonathan Steingard, frontman for the Christian rock band Hawk Nelson, has gone public with some personal news.

item.title: CNN's John King crunches US coronavirus numbers as states reopen
item.description: CNN's John King looks at the numbers around the coronavirus pandemic across the US as states begin the process of reopening.

item.title: How scientists found the universe's 'missing' matter
item.description: Mysterious fast radio bursts have been used to unlock another strange aspect of the universe: the case of the "missing matter."

item.title: Meet the 13-year-old who graduated from college with four associate's degrees
item.description: With his love for video games and petty arguments with his older sister, Jack Rico might seem like any other 13-year-old.

item.title: Chrissy Teigen got Covid-19 test in prep for breast implant removal
item.description: Chrissy Teigen didn't get tested for coronavirus for fun.

item.title: Bones of about 60 mammoths found at airport construction site
item.description: Archaeologists have found the skeletal remains of dozens of huge mammoths at a construction site outside Mexico City.

item.title: Cat disappears into priest's robes during online sermon
item.description: An online sermon being delivered by a senior British clergyman was derailed when an intrepid cat wandered between his legs and disappeared into his robes.

item.title: A turtle smashed through a woman's windshield while she was driving on the highway
item.description: A woman in Georgia was left shell shocked when a turtle went flying across the highway and through her windshield, nearly striking her passenger in the face.

item.title: The 'Mozart of Chess' on being like Michael Jordan
item.description: Greatness cannot be achieved without sacrifice. While it is the fire that burns inside that fuels the brilliance, the pursuit for perfection can also torment, turning relationships to ashes and niggling at the soul. The gifted can be loved and disliked. They can achieve immortality but still be flawed. They are, after all, human. But, ultimately, their extraordinary talent overshadows everything.

item.title: Video shows bear following boy during a family hike
item.description: An Italian boy named Alessandro was captured on video while he was being followed by a brown bear during a hike with his family.

item.title: Australian wildlife park celebrates the birth of its first koala since New South Wales' devastating bushfires
item.description: A wildlife park in Australia is celebrating the arrival of its first baby koala since bushfires devastated the area.

item.title: Earthquake hits during Jacinda Ardern's live interview
item.description: A magnitude 5.8 earthquake struck near New Zealand's capital Wellington while the country's Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern was discussing New Zealand's ongoing lifting of coronavirus restrictions in a live interview.

item.title: Why Thailand isn't reopening to international tourists yet
item.description: With news that many countries in Europe are reopening to tourism in time for summer, travelers with their sights set on Asia are anxiously awaiting word on when they'll be given the green light to visit their favorite destination.

item.title: US Secretary of State's decision jeopardizes billions of dollars in trade and could rattle the global economy
Pandemic opens door to China's long sought goal
item.description: Sometimes, the best time to act isn't when you're at your strongest, but when your rivals are weakest.

item.title: 99.99% of Hong Kong can 'go about their lives', official says. Just blocks away, hundreds were being arrested
item.description: The second highest ranking official in Hong Kong insists a controversial new national security law being drafted by the Chinese government will not erode the city's democratic freedoms.

item.title: Hong Kong's richest man defends China's plan
item.description: Hong Kong's richest man has defended China's plan to introduce a national security law in the semi-autonomous city, a move that has reignited mass protests and renewed questions about the future of the global business hub.

item.title: 100,000 deaths: America's Covid-19 toll brings its own awful judgments on Trump's response
item.description: â€¢ US passes grim milestone in under 4 months

item.title: Christian Cooper: Please stop death threats against woman who called cops on me
item.description: â€¢ Hundreds take to streets after George Floyd dies following police encounter

item.title: Inside one of the world's largest brothels, a desperate situation is unfolding
item.description: â€¢ Why the lockdown is disastrous for women

item.title: The reality of Trump's threat to 'regulate' or 'close' social media platforms
item.description: President Donald Trump threatened to "regulate" or even "close" down social media platforms in a series of tweets over the last day after Twitter added a fact-check label to some of his posts. But Trump's options for cracking down on Twitter and other platforms over how they moderate their platforms are somewhat limited, legal experts say.
